issue.title: [C++] Investigate spawning arbitrary callbacks from StopToken
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12938](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12938). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
In some situations, we may want to forward stop requests to external runtimes, e.g. gRPC (see https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10318 ), without polling.

Ideally, one may temporarily add a callback to a StopToken. This bears complications, especially in the case where the stop request comes from a signal handler.
